post_text: In lieu of a traditional State FFA Convention, the Ohio FFA Association recently held an online celebration to recognize the success of chapters and members across the state. The New Bremen FFA chapter and members received several honors this year. The chapter was recognized as a Gold Medal Chapter in Ohio, a top ten chapter in Ohio in the areas of: Strengthening Agriculture, Building Communities, and Growing Leaders of the National Chapter Quality Standards. In addition, the chapter was named as a Top Ten Chapter overall in Ohio. Member Liam Homan won the Beef Placement Proficiency Award and his application will be forwarded to the national level. Members Jessica Fledderjohann, Max Homan and Grace Wilker were recognized for their gold rated officer books. In addition, Jessica Fledderjohann, Liam Homan, Max Homan and Ashton Ritter received the State FFA Degree, which is only awarded to 2% of Ohio FFA Members. Congratulations to the chapter, all of our FFA Members and to our Advisor, Mrs. Homan!

The New Bremen Community Backpack Committee is a volunteer organization that provides school supplies and backpacks to students living in the New Bremen School District. We want all students to start each school year with the supplies that they need to succeed. Assistance paying school fees is also available, as well as any other costs that are associated with attending school. The “No-Shame” lunch fund is also funded by this committee. This fund ensures that all students receive the same lunch as every other student, regardless of the balance in their lunch account.
